fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64485].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

1. Try importing issues from more than one projects using the importer plugin 

Expected Behavior:

Importer must display the name of the repository from which the issues are currently being imported.

Actual Behavior:
Importer does not display the name of the repository from which the which issues are currently being imported.

P.S: This would be really useful if the user is trying to import issues from multiple repositories.
fields.summary: Display the name of the repository from which issues are currently being imported
Ability to send e-Mail notification when a issue is created during import
Redmine importer - make importing users optional
Allow user to specify Date-0 for relative dates in JSON files
JIM does not add information to Global Ranking on import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64480].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Issues in Pivotal don't have a *Priority* set, and thus are imported in to JIRA with no Priority set. This results in the *Priority* being hidden when using defaults and viewing a just-imported Issue.

However, when Editing an existing Issue or Creating a new one in this Project, because Priority is typically part of the *Scheme* for the project, it is not possible _not_ to set the Priority.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add some sort of check such that imports to an empty Project don't have *Priority* in the related Screens.
h3. Workaround

Define a new "None" priority, and then manually bulk-update imported Issues to set Priorities.
fields.summary: When importing from Pivotal to an empty Project, remove Priority from relevant Screens

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64479].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
While migrating from redmine 2.6.3 to JIRA 7.0.10 user migration is performed, but all groups are silently ignored. 

h3. Suggested Solution
kindly add a feature for redmine importer in JIRA to migrate information about groups, stored on per issue basis in redmine to JIRA.
fields.summary: Add group migration feature in Redmine importer
As an Importer, I'd like to run a Sample Import to validate settings
As a JIRA admin I would like JIM to support a Bugnet importer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64475].
  {panel}

As part of the Cloud First initiative usages of server side http session should be removed.
Currently Issue navigator is using  ActionContext.getSession() in StudioImport:
* doDefault
* doFinished

Also it's being used in ProjectImportBean, ImportAll and SetupImport but I think these classes are only being used in server version. Can this be confirmed?
fields.summary: Remove usage of server side session on StudioImport
issue key checker in the csv import winzard
Native JIRA Import from Zendesk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64472].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Customer would like to import Trac data into their Atlassian Cloud instance however the Trac DB is PostgreSQL.
Per the [JIM Importing Issues|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/importing-issues-692420684.html#ImportingIssues-ImportingissuesfromCSVfiles,FogBugzOnDemand,PivotalTrackerandTrac] documentation, only SQLite Databases are supported when importing from Trac.

h3. Suggested Solution
Expand Database compatibility for Trac import into the Atlassian Cloud
 
h3. Workaround 
It is not noted JIRA Server Instances have this limitation:
- Setup a Staging JIRA Server and Import the Trac Data to it
- Perform a [JIRA Server to Cloud Migration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Migrating+from+JIRA+Server+to+JIRA+Cloud]
fields.summary: Support for Importing from Trac Using Databases Other than SQLite to the Atlassian Cloud
Migrate default values for Mantis issues (not stored in DB)
Allow mapping of users during Bitbucket issues import
JIM imports fails when transition between wizard screen takes to long

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64468].
  {panel}

If JSON import contains issues with a status that is invalid for the selected workflow they are not going to be imported, by the rest of the import will be performed.

When importing lots of data this is a huge productivity killer because you end-up with a project that has one some issues imported and also that has lots of issuelinks broken due to this. 

Always you have to remove all the imported issues and start over again. Removing all these issues (like 20.000) is very hard, and not even possible using the Bulk edit.

This is a request to prevent the import in case of errors like this, allowing the user to  fix / regenerate the JSON file, or to repair the workflow configuration and to attempt the import again.
fields.summary: Prevent entire import if any status is invalid
Unify attachment handling in JIM API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64466].
  {panel}

FogBugz added rich text editing into their product (or it was there but we didn't notice?) which means that some of the issues we import are now in a broken format that's not either text or wiki markup.

We should offer users some solution for this.

Raised from https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Importing+Data+from+FogBugz+for+Your+Server?focusedCommentId=419005067#comment-419005067

Cc [~clepetit]
fields.summary: Support rich text format in FogBugz
Remove JIM-Bridge plugin from OD
Provide the ability to CSV import comment based on the its visibilty
Make it possible to select how to map usernames when importing CSV
Fogbugz value mapper ignores (de)selected projects when displaying possible values
Conflicts are shown even for skipped issues
slow user import from Redmine to JIRA
Bulk add to Groups in JSON
Redmine Importer fails to import some atachements

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64455].
  {panel}

When user try to import a project from pivotal tracker, they will see this warning message:
{code}
Commenter named Spiderman not found. Creating issue with currently logged in user instead
{code}

*Steps to reproduced it*
# Go to External System Import > choose Import from Pivotal Tracker.
# Key in username and password and expand *Advanced*
# Check *Map user names* and *Use an existing configuration file* option ([^test.txt]).
# Click Next and choose the desired project and proceed.
# Get this warning message:
!pivotal-tracker.png|thumbnail!

*Cause*
One of the member in the Pivotal Tracker project is being removed.

*Change Request*
As a user, it will be great if we can revise the warning message to be more meaningful or clear of what's going on.
fields.summary: Pivotal Tracker warning message
Improve errors readability in the logs to include more information about the error
As a JIRA Admin I would like JIM to support a codespaces importer
Make language changes is JIM accordingly to TW review
As a JIRA admin I would like JIM to support a ServiceNow importer
Import UI of the landing page
Import all Trac change history, not just comments.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64448].
  {panel}

I don't know that this is limited to CSV (and I suspect it is not) but it is the module I care most about.

When importing the file I can map the field "assigned to" >>>> "assignee", perfect.  And the same is true for "Created By" to "Reporter" But Jira assumes 3 things that are not correct!
# usernames are simply the spaceless concatenation of real names (how many of your customers use "employee IDs" that have nothing to do with name?)
# emails _always_ follow a LASTNAMEf@domain.com pattern where 'f' is the first initial of first name (what about first.last, or fLAST, or f.last ?)
# if these assumptions don't line up, it must be a new user (but in reality our jira is connected to our enterprise ldap and knows _all_ users !)

SO my suggestion pretty simple:

Please allow the import the option of *looking up users* based on imported username/real name/email, and select the field to search by.  I could then very easily tell Jira to lookup users by the "User Name Contains", "Full Name Contains:" or "Email Contains"  and pull back a valid user ID, Email, and Real name.

I would much rather this then have to write a macro to update my csv file replacing "last, first" with "employeeID".
fields.summary: Allow email and username mapping instead of naive defaults

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64447].
  {panel}

When importing data from Mantis into JIRA:
* {{Fixed in Version}} field is automatically mapped to Fix Version/s
* {{Target Version}} field is not mapped

Customers would also like to map *Target Version* field but find no way to do so. Is it possible to consider this a new feature for importing data from Mantis?
fields.summary: Map Target Version when importing from Mantis
Create a kickstarter plugin for developers wishing to write their own importers
The customfield created in the Trac import should be reusable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64429].
  {panel}

If you try to import a large CSV file it can cause JIRA to become unresponsive as it gets stuck in full GC and will eventually generate an OutOfMemoryError: GC Overhead limit exceeded.

h3. Steps to Reproduce:

Attempt to import the attached CSV.

h3. Expected Results:

It would be ideal if JIRA could verify whether or not the file is a certain size and refuse to import it rather than negatively affect the the instance.

h3. Actual Results:

It will use up all the memories and JIRA will eventually generate an OOME:

{noformat}
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: GC overhead limit exceeded
	at org.apache.lucene.store.BufferedIndexInput.refill(BufferedIndexInput.java:210)
	at org.apache.lucene.store.BufferedIndexInput.readByte(BufferedIndexInput.java:39)
	at org.apache.lucene.store.IndexInput.readInt(IndexInput.java:71)
	at org.apache.lucene.store.BufferedIndexInput.readInt(BufferedIndexInput.java:153)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentTermEnum.<init>(SegmentTermEnum.java:50)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.TermInfosReader.<init>(TermInfosReader.java:110)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentCoreReaders.<init>(SegmentCoreReaders.java:75)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentReader.get(SegmentReader.java:114)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter$ReaderPool.get(IndexWriter.java:701)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter$ReaderPool.get(IndexWriter.java:676)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.BufferedDeletesStream.applyDeletes(BufferedDeletesStream.java:249)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.doFlush(IndexWriter.java:3552)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.flush(IndexWriter.java:3489)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.prepareCommit(IndexWriter.java:3352)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.commitInternal(IndexWriter.java:3425)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.commit(IndexWriter.java:3407)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.IndexWriter.commit(IndexWriter.java:3391)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.WriterWrapper.commit(WriterWrapper.java:132)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndexEngine$WriterReference.commit(DefaultIndexEngine.java:220)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndexEngine$FlushPolicy$2.commit(DefaultIndexEngine.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndexEngine$FlushPolicy.perform(DefaultIndexEngine.java:84)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndexEngine.write(DefaultIndexEngine.java:154)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.DefaultIndex.perform(DefaultIndex.java:32)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.QueueingIndex$Task.index(QueueingIndex.java:144)
	at com.atlassian.jira.index.QueueingIndex$Task.run(QueueingIndex.java:125)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)
{noformat}

h3. Notes:

File to replicate and my GC log attached. In this particular example the problem was present due to over 1 million "empty" lines:

{noformat}
,,,,,^M
,,,,,^M
,,,,,^M
,,,,,^M
,,,,,^M
,,,,,^M
,,,,,^M
,,,,,^M
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Remove the empty lines using your favourite text editor and attempt the import again. In this example I did it with the following:

{noformat}
cat filename.csv | grep -v ",,,,,^M" > modified.csv
{noformat}

The difference:

{noformat}
$ wc -l modified.csv 
      52 modified.csv
$ wc -l filename.csv 
 1048605 filename.csv
{noformat}
fields.summary: Verify the size of a CSV before attempting an import
Ability to preserve ranking when importing from CSV
Allow users to specify "created" and "updated" values for Worklogs in JSON Importer
As as user I want to see the list of issues after successful import.
Support Clone field from Bugzilla

API key to authenticate to Redmine

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64422].
  {panel}

Currently the Import CSV functionality needs to have the 'Date Import' format specified during the import process. This can cause some problems during import if it's not set correctly, for example the parsing fails with the below exception:

{noformat}
2015-05-01 15:35:19,876 WARN - Cannot add value [ 04/24/2015 ] to CustomField Build date in Issue with summary 'New Accessory Launch: SUPM44640 - HTC M9 Tech 21 Impact Shield'. Exception Message: Invalid date format. Please enter the date in the format "dd/MMM/yy".
com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.FieldValidationException: Invalid date format. Please enter the date in the format "dd/MMM/yy".
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.converters.DatePickerConverterImpl.getTimestamp(DatePickerConverterImpl.java:47)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.DateCFType.getSingularObjectFromString(DateCFType.java:121)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.DateCFType.getSingularObjectFromString(DateCFType.java:53)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.AbstractSingleFieldType.getValueFromCustomFieldParams(AbstractSingleFieldType.java:230)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.customfields.CustomFieldValueFactory.prepareValueForCustomField(CustomFieldValueFactory.java:55)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.customfields.CustomFieldsUtil.setCustomFieldValueForIssue(CustomFieldsUtil.java:182)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.importExternalCustomFields(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:1244)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.createIssue(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:895)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.importIssues(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:771)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.doImport(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:397)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ImporterCallable.call(ImporterCallable.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ImporterCallable.call(ImporterCallable.java:15)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:528)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:491)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Unknown Source)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ForkedThreadExecutor$ForkedRunnableDecorator.run(ForkedThreadExecutor.java:254)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
{noformat}

It would be ideal if the importer plugin could automagically figure out what the date format is, using science, so that users don't have to set this, as it can be a bit confusing.

h3. Set the 'Date Format' correctly during import.
fields.summary: Automate the Date Format functionality in Import CSV

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64421].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The Bitbucket Importer Plugin for JIM seems have yet to be updated for JIRA 7 and still at version 1.0.15

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the needed update to JIRA 7 users
fields.summary: Bitbucket Importer Plugin for JIM update JIRA 7.x

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64420].
  {panel}

The latest JIM version ships with the beta version of JSON importer/exporter. However, the JSON importer/exporter modules are not enabled by default, hence the modules needs to be enabled manually by going to {{Administration > Manage Add-ons > Show System Plugins > JIRA Importers Plugin}}, and enable the following modules:
- JSON (beta)(searchrequest-json)
- JSON (beta)(issue-json)

However, this step is not documented anywhere in the JIM documentation. It will be great if we can have this documented in JIM documentation, so that users will know that they have to enable the JSON module first before using it in JIRA.
fields.summary: Improve JIM JSON importer/exporter documentation
Create issue with all details at once

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64418].
  {panel}

Customer has suggested an implementation of new features such as

"Test Run":
Feature which runs a list of checking on the csv files to filter out the errors and warnings which will possibly hit into during the import. This allow user to perform correction on the respective csv files before the import.

Stop Import Option:
A feature to stop import once a warning or errors has been found. A checkbox can be included at the import wizard where the user can select whether to ignore warnings or halt (&rollback) on warning. This can avoid user to import issues which may have lost some information due to the warnings(such as format).
fields.summary: "Test Run" feature or "Stop Import Option" for CSV importer
As a system administrator I'd like to save the configuration before starting the import process

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64416].
  {panel}

h4. Current Results:
Currently JIRA Importers plugin only has the option to map projects, custom fields, statuses and issue link types. Whereas, there is no such option to Bugzilla components. They are simply created in JIRA, no mapping is possible during the import.

h4. Proposed Results:
Would be beneficial for JIRA administrator have the option to map Bugzilla components during the import, as it would avoid post import work to adjust component values.
fields.summary: As an administrator, I'd like to have the ability to map Buzilla components to JIRA components
Redmine Importer does not allow mapping custom fields do those defined in JIRA, causing fields duplication

Allow the configuration of the number of threads for the background reindex process

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64411].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when deleting a custom field context, there are no warnings or confirmation pop-ups. The context is deleted directly, which can be problematic in the event that the custom field context is used widely, and the deletion was an accident.

h3. Suggested Solution

Implement a pop-up that asks the user to confirm whether or not the user wants to delete the context, preferably also showing the list of issues that are using that context
fields.summary: Custom Field context deletion warning
Accessing Health Check via gg

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64404].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Right now, there is no easy place/page where one can see the latest information for a JIRA project, for example its current state, anything urgent to be done, easy links to documents, etc.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add a section in the 'Summary' page of the project. An example of how it would be added, as well as the information that it would show, is as follows :

!JIRA Project Informations.JPG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add ability to add a 'Project Information' section in a Project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64403].
  {panel}

h5. Issue Summary

If a customer attempts to write a JQL that compares to date fields, this JQL is unacceptable by JIRA because it currently unsupported as [our expected|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-fields-reference-764478339.html] supports only specific dates in the format {{YYYY/MM/dd}}, {{startofmonth()}} or durations like {{"-3w"}} (_refer to the Created section_).

h5. Usage Scenario

If a development team would like to compare or measure how many fixes were released before the scheduled due date, it would be great to be able to create a report that compares using JQL:
{code}
releasedate < "due date"
{code}

h5. Existing Behavior

JIRA would throw an error if you attempt to use the JQL as defined above as it would expect you to use the duration or actual date as described in the summary section.

h5. Expected Behavior

JIRA would allow the user to compare JQL of 2 different date fields.
fields.summary: Allow comparison of Date Fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64400].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Customer:
_We have an ongoing (parent) task and wanted to use a form to submit_
_subtasks that will be coming through_

h3. Suggested Solution
_Minimize the amount of tasks in a project_
fields.summary: Issue Collector with Sub-Task issue type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64399].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Doesn't have an option to directly print the attachment in an issue. It's necessary to download/open the file to then print.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a print option directly when you mouse over an attachment in JIRA

h3. Why this is important
It would be easier and quicker if we had an option to directly print the file when mouse hovering the attachment in the issue view.

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Print directly by hovering hover the attachment
Retain the value of Security Level on the Move Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64396].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

According to the [JIRA REST API|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/7.3.3] documentation, {{POST /rest/api/2/user}} can be used to create a new user, and that user will be created in the first writable directory in directory order for the application making the request. 

h3. Suggested Solution

As an improvement, we could allow the ability to specify a directory when adding users. This could make the process more transparent and give the administrator more control by taking out the element of chance, in the event the administrator is unaware of the directories mapped to an application and the order they're in.
fields.summary: Allow new users to be created in specific directories via the REST API
Create an admin panel to see and edit user properties (Not UI user properties)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64392].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At the present moment, all notifications sent by JIRA refer to the same Message-ID in the *In-Reply-to:* header, causing e-mails to not get threaded properly in mail clients when messages are not sorted by ascending date.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make each notification sent by JIRA refer to the previous notification e-mail's Message-ID, creating a proper relation between e-mail notifications.

h3. Why this is important
This will allow e-mail notifications to stay in the proper order should the user use a sorting option other than by ascending date.
fields.summary: JIRA should thread e-mails properly
Show story Points on Planned Sprints
Disable enter-edit-mode when clicking issue description

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64388].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to reproduce
 # Sign up for an Atlassian Cloud
 # [Connect Bitbucket with JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/connect-bitbucket-cloud-to-jira-cloud-applications-814190686.html]

h4. Expected results

JIRA and Bitbucket are connected
h4. Actual results

Bitbucket returns this error
{quote}*This add-on is misconfigured. Contact the vendor for assistance.*

descriptor_uri: The add-on server returned invalid data. Please contact the add-on vendor for help. Here's the error we encountered - Invalid JSON: u'https://sumtingwong.atlassian.net, sumtingwong.atlassian.net' is not a 'uri' at baseUrl
{quote}
h4. Other info
 * This happens to all new JIRA Software instance.

h4. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Unable to connect new Atlassian Cloud with Bitbucket

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64387].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

JIRA Issue collector behaviour in latest Safari on OSX is confusing. This browser has disabled 3rd party cookies by default and despite the warning about this, you can still create issues. But when you hit the submit button you see another warning saying "there was a problem submitting your feedback". I.e.: *you can't submit issues on Safari by default*.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in to staging Bitbucket (staging.bb-inf.net) with Atlassian account in Safari
 # Go to Labs (tab on the left) and enable "Atlassian editor" integration
 # Go to [https://staging.bb-inf.net/owallhult/sverige/pull-requests/1/readmemd-edited-online-with-bitbucket/diff] and try to add any comment. In the top right corner of the editor there's a "Feedback" button. Press it to open JIRA Issue Collector iframe.

h3. Expected Results
 * Warning about 3rd party cookies is brighter and "submit" button is either disabled or hidden at all.

h3. Actual Results
 * Warning about disabled 3rd party cookies is small and the submit button is still active
 * When you click the submit button you see a confusing message (summary)
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Collector cannot create issues in Safari with disabled 3rd party cookies (submit button is still active)
Let Post-Function to Override Default "Issue Security Level" Value During Issue Creation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64385].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a JIRA instance have more than 65000 issues with all worklog on each ticket before '2016-01-01'
# Go to the issue search page and run the JQL {{worklogDate < '2016-01-01'}}

h3. Expected behaviour
It should show the result with all issue. 

h3. Actual behaviour
It gives an error on the UI:
{{An unknown error occurred while trying to perform a search.}}

The same issue reproduced with the clause worklogAuthor

h3. Workaround solution
* With the bug https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-64315, it is still possible to use the lower case clause which is {{worklogdate}} and {{worklogauthor}} to get the output.
* Reduce search scope for _worklogDate_ function so it return less then 65000 issues
fields.summary: Issue search with worklog clause throws an error "An unknown error occurred while trying to perform a search."

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64383].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
[Favorite Filters Gadget|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Adding+the+Favorite+Filters+Gadget] page doesn't mention possible performance impact which can be caused by this gadget. 
Previously documentation page for JIRA 6.4 mentioned that, see https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/adding-the-favorite-filters-gadget-720416970.html

h3. Suggested Solution
Please mention possible performance impact caused by _Favorite Filters_ Gadget. 
See related JRA-43040.
fields.summary: Documentation request: mention performance impact for Favorite Filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64378].
  {panel}

When navigating from the simple search to the advanced search, the Fix/Affected Version generated by the simple search actually contains an id rather than the name value.

How to reproduce the problem:

Got to https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa

In the "Project" box (below the 'query' field), select "JIRA"

In the "Fix For" box below, select version "4.4.5" (for instance).

Then Click on search.

Then click on advanced.

You will see an id in place of the version number (see attachements).

Note: this seems to be happening only for the Version id. This is not happening for Reporter, Assignee, Status, Components,...)
fields.summary: Fix Version number is converted to id when switching from simple to advanced search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64375].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When submitting an issue through the issue collector it does not provide an option for the issue key. This wouldn't be available via [Advanced use of the JIRA issue Collector|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/advanced-use-of-the-jira-issue-collector-802592648.html]. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the ability to provide an external issue key. 
h3. Why this is important
In some shops although the user would not have access to JIRA. When interacting between client and company interactions it would be helpful to have a reference number. 
 
h3. Workaround 
Use [E-mail this issue|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.metainf.jira.plugin.emailissue/cloud/overview] to send a notification to users out the company in the create issue transition of the workflow associated with the issue collector project. 

Use [Service Desk|https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/service-desk] as it allows interaction between external users with more robust functionality.
fields.summary: Provide issue key when submitting creating an issue via issue collector.
"Clone" functionality triggers "Move" functionality as well

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64373].
  {panel}

Customer reported and I got reproduce it in my local environment.

 

Steps to Reproduce on Firefox:
 * Open an issue.
 * Click on title.
 * Edit 
 * Paste a previously text copied from clipboard.
 * It has no effect. 
 * If you right-click and paste it will work.

 

It is not a problem in Chrome.
fields.summary: Ctrl-V Shortcut to paste text into issue title doesn't work on Firefox

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64368].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when navigating through groups via the Administration menu, there is no easy way for the admin of the JIRA instance to view any project roles that are associated with the group.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add the ability to view the project roles assocciated with a group when viewing the groups via User management > Groups menu
fields.summary: Show the project roles of a group when viewing it in User Management

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64365].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently if you have an evaluation license for JIRA Core, JIRA Software, or JIRA Service Desk and it expires. It will disable activity for users that are associated with a valid commercial license. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an option  to delete the valid license for any admin who logs in or only disable the users who are associated with the trial license.

h3. Why this is important
 This can cause unnecessary customer friction instance wide for users who are associated with a valid license. 
h3. Workaround 
Delete the trial license.
fields.summary: Evaluation License Expires disables user activity associated with a valid license.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64363].
{panel}
Current JIRA documentation for system settings:

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-jira-application-options-818578873.html] 

maybe this one but it's 404d & I can't find it in the master so I'm not sure:

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-general-settings-868982978.html]

Indicate that the default setting for Use GZIP compress is 'OFF'.  In reality, the default value is 'ON'.
fields.summary: JIRA application options docs lists incorrect default value for GZIP compression

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64362].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
No option to disable People and Dates section side bar.  
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow option to restrict the view ability of the People and dates bar section for certain users. As well as the JIRA Software software panel. The [How to disable Agile side panel from issue view screen|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+disable+Agile+side+panel+from+issue+view+screen] as of JIRA 7 is now outdated. 
h3. Why this is important
 If you wish to conceal particular individual names or other criteria from "public" or "external" company users.
fields.summary: Disable JIRA sidebar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64361].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Images will not load in either the description or comment box when attaching a screenshot in visual mode

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use the Print Screen function in Windows. 
# Load Chrome and create an issue. 
# Select Visual mode for the description or a comment. 
# Use the paste function in either the description or the comment. 
# Refresh the page images and thumbnails load fine in Chrome.
# Launch IE and access the same issue.

h3. Expected Results
The thumbnail and the Image loads. 
h3. Actual Results
The thumbnail loads but the image fails to render.
h3. Notes
The only error I see when I click the show picture option is:
{code}
Deprecated undefined "DisplayAbove has been deprecated and will be removed in a future release."
{code}

h3.Workaround
If you paste the screenshot in visual mode with IE it works fine in both Chrome and IE. Also if you use chrome and text mode then paste the screen shot. It loads in IE as well.
fields.summary: When using the Ctrl+V Function to paste a screen shot in Chrome the image fails to load in IE11.
